text: Frontiers is an ITV television crime drama series was produced by Carlton Television, broadcast between 7 May and 25 June 1996.https://itvstudios.com/programmes/frontiers The series, created by acclaimed writer Stephen Poliakoff, focuses on the rivalry between two rival police chiefs of the Special Crime Squad and their respective teams of officers.http://mediatel.co.uk/newsline/1996/03/19/itv-announces-new- programme-schedule/ Co-written with Sam Donovan and Sandy Welch, only a single series of six episodes was broadcast, as despite a high-profile cast, including Kevin McNally, Clare Holman, Hywel Bennett and Philip Glenister,http://www.philipglenister.com/biog.html the series failed to impact audiences and was quickly axed.http://www.screenonline.org.uk/people/id/510844/credits.html Amelia Bullmore, Fay Ripley and singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor also appeared in the series. Thomas Sutcliffe of The Independent said of the series; "Stephen Poliakoff is noted as a Special Adviser to Frontiers. Stephen Poliakoff, the respected playwright, that is. This is inexplicable, unless they have simply ignored his advice, because Frontiers is the apotheosis of the Angry Shouting Copper show, a mail-order catalogue for every exhausted cliché of the genre – from the lazily rotating extractor fan which casts such a gothic light, to the stand-up rows in gloomy corridors.
